intro: Collomia gracilis var. minuartioides, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, and its flowers are often arranged in clusters along the stems. It thrives in rocky soils and is commonly found in alpine and subalpine environments. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant is well adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
